You could ride up to 4 on the cyclone.  Other than that there were slides for 2 people at once and one person.  Some slides had tubes (provided free of charge) and some did not.  There was a person checking the tubes at several areas.  We had a damaged tube once, and told one of the guys checking them, and he removed it right away from the area.  They also had lifevests (free of charge).

The lines moved quickly all day and were not long to begin with.  I didn't have to walk all over the place to get to different slides.  It was layed out well such that different family members could go on multiple slides or in the pool and still be in the same area.  I didn't feel I was running around after each one.

Lastly, everyone was very friendly beginning with the greeting at the gate and even as we were leaving.  I didn't see the lifeguards talking unnecessarily, but they were also very nice with assisting all the children and adults in their areas or responsibility.
Run down and rather dirty. Chairs had cob webs and wave pool area needed swept first thing in am.Concession are is unkept and food quality poor. Prices are high for what is provided.

name: Verizon Arena
reviews: I hate it when I go to this arena. I go just because of my little girl wanting to see Disney on Ice. Thankfully she has outgrown that over rated show. If you sit in a seat you better stay there because moving around will be extremely difficult!!! I'm 5'9" tall. Normal weight and the seating has to be the worst.

I’m stoked that Simmons now has the naming rights. They’ve stepped up and are doing a facelift to the exterior. For years you would drive by it and see a stained ugly exterior..  pathetic up keep in my opinion. It was disgusting inside too. Now that Simmons has it, the original shine has been brought back and we all are better off because of it. This Arena is the signature arena for events in central Arkansas. We can to see the Hogs play. Great night. Great crowd!!  I caught the exterior name change one day from the highway...  need to tell the guys about the missing “k”... 😂

Came here for multiple events, concerts and a graduation. This place can do it all with no issue. the only complaint I have is the seats seem a bit small but tat is with most places, just like in an airplane.

Easy venue to get in and out of, security was tight, but moved along quite well. Not sure I'd sit in the higher up level, but looks like a venue where there isn't a bad seat to see a show since it's a smaller venue.  We'd travel here again to see a show at this venue.

We attended a concert here.  We were in section 203 (row 5).  I was afraid the seating might be bad, but it was good for a concert in-the-round.  Never felt like we missed out on anything happening on stage.  Easy for someone to drop us off before the concert and pick us up afterward.

name: Mosaic Templars Cultural Center
reviews: I was here for a historical grant class. The center is very educational. Its about the African American history in Arkansas and Little Rock. It is worth a visit if your in Little Rock

A must see of old black history, also be sure to walk down to the Arkansas Flag and Banner and take a tour of Dreamland Ballroom, Ella Fitzgerald, Duke Ellington and many famous groups performed there, a superb place to see.

the building itself is a splended rebuild of an historic African American center of culture.  the building burned several years ago and was completely rebuilt ... looks like the old but with all new systems.  I houses a thorough and interesting collection of African American exhibits depicting the story of 9th Street when it was the center of African American business, culture and entertainment..

While this is out of the immediate downtown area, this place is not to be missed.  There is plenty of parking in the back and touring is free...donations accepted.  There is a lovely bookstore.  The exhibits provide a history and overview of life in the African American Community and in Arkansas. The displays are well-presented and there is much to be learned.  I would call this a must-see place for lovers of history and culture.

I ended up here looking for something to do between checking out of the hotel and catching a flight home. It was great! Lots of great history.  And the staff member who greeted us also took the time to give us a brief history of the building, the organization and the neighborhood. 

Take an hour or two and visit if you are in Little Rock!

This is a great museum! It's only a few years old, so everything is sparkling new! It's an African American history museum, but it's not only for African Americans... it's everyone's history!!! The museum is located in the historic 9th street district, which was the Black Business District during segregation. The actual building that houses the museum has it's own history, which is cool.

If you ask the front desk, they can print out a scavenger hunt for the kids to complete, which is good because the museum isn't really child-oriented, the scavenger hunt gives them something fun to do.

 Be sure to check the calendar on their website as they have a lot of adult and kid programing, all of it free! The gift shop has an amazing selection of books on black history, as well as locally made jewlery, art, and quilts. Definetly worth checking out!

If you want to know anything about African American history in Arkansas this is the place to go. The permanent exhibits are stellar! And Mosaic always has fascinating temporary exhibits on relevant topics as it relates to the African diaspora. If you can, take your whole family, and spend the day here. You definitely won't regret it!

Interesting pieces of information in this building some of the original stonework in the entrance after the building burnt down its well set out loads of pictures and things to read worth a visit its free entry

We were given a private tour of this center.  In this building you can view permanent exhibits that tell both the present and past history of African Americans in Arkansas from 1870 to the present time. This is the ideal place to bring your children for a history lesson.  They will learn about post-Civil War life which led to the birthplace of Black entrepreneurship in Arkansas including the Arkansas Black Hall of Fame, art inspired by Negro League baseball, the fine art of Jazz and the "Inauguration of Hope", a life size memorial to the historic inauguration of President Barak Obama.This center was one of my favorite places to visit in Little Rock.

Amazing facility!  The museum is beautifully curated!  This is a must-see of African-American history in Arkansas.  The event space is very nice and nostalgic...I won’t give away the secrets!  The staff is extremely knowledgeable and they also have a great gift shop.  Perfect historical tour and event/banquet space for school groups, church groups, family/family reunion groups...definitely make this a stop on the itinerary:-). And if you want oral history, ask for Ms. Annie!!!!

This place is a must see for history.  They also provide awesome programs and services for the community.  I attended a Paint and Sip in February and the people and experience were wonderful.  The Art Exhibits and Historical Exhibition are amazing.  This place is a MUST SEE when traveling to Little Rock.

name: Arkansas Repertory Theatre
reviews: Always a lovely experience attending any performance at this venue.  Intimate setting with good seating and easy access and parking.  Conveniently located to various sites in the area.

What a show, Million Dollar Quartet. It was wonderful flashback of the 50's with Jerry Lee Lewis, Carl Perkins, Elvis Presley, and Johnny Cash. Almost 2 hours of  fun packed entertainment. Enjoyed The Rep.

Known as The Rep is the state’s longest running nonprofit resident theatre.  It has 377 seats and all are super good seats. I highly recommend it if you’re visiting Little Rock. You have to pay for public parking.

Saw a really good play. “Million Dollar Quartet”. Loved it. Really nice place. The building was very clean and easy to find my way around. I don’t think there was a bad seat in the house with the way everything was set up.
So glad to see the rep open. If you live in or near Little Rock you should come to one of the amazing shows. You won’t be disappointed.

name: H.U. Lee International Gate and Garden
reviews: Its a very nice big door. There is bird netting across the entire roof/gables or whatever they are called. Open the door take a look inside and that is all folks. I am sure I am not informed enough to understand the meaning but neither are there information areas to be easily seen that explains.  Great photo op.
Not much to it really but it was interesting.  It really only take a few minutes to check out.  So if looking for something quick, it's good if you're already passing by that way.
The garden is beautiful and easy to relax and reflect in.  Fountain is clean and has seating around it.  Beautiful spot for pics!
It is a beautiful garden located right next to our hotel on Main street.  It has easy access and offers many photo opportunities.
The cutest decor and statues. Really unexpected to see the garden behind the hut. Don’t miss it, you must see it.
If you are close to it then stop in but I wouldn’t make a trip just to see it. It’s pretty & has some fountain seating.

Neat little garden and worth a stop if your passing by.  The entrance is intriguing and once inside there is star shaped fountain in the center along with statues around the walkways.  We spent maybe 15 minutes there which is plenty.  I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to stop here.
The garden is beautiful and easy to relax and reflect in.  Fountain is clean and has seating around it.  Beautiful spot for pics!

name: Testament: The Little Rock Nine Monument
reviews: Facing the front of the Capitol, the statues are located to right and slightly to the back. If you do not know they are there, you will miss an opportunity to reflect and be thankful. Make the effort to find the statues. Stay in school ...take the hard courses, pay forward the price the Little Rock Nine has already paid!

This memorial to the Central High nine sits outside in front of the Capitol. President Clinton had it made and placed here to remind all future Governors of this. They statue's are life size and the words at each statue are from the nine. Take the time to see it. I recommend you visit after going thru Central HS tour.
Here you will see the statues of the Little Rock Nine Students. I suggest a tour thru the Central High Museum to learn the history of these students, and what they went thru to get an education.
A haunting, yet at the same time very moving reminder that, despite the efforts of a few who cannot read or chose to disregard our Constitution, we’re all the same, just different.

We did miss this on our visit to state capitol didn't realise it was at the side of the building so had to return again today as I did not want to miss seeing this monument I actually think it should be at the front of the building and not where it is. It's a really nice monument a  piece of History.We visited the central High School the day before so this was a must visit.

This memorial to the Central High nine sits outside in front of the Capitol. President Clinton had it made and placed here to remind all future Governors of this. They statue's are life size and the words at each statue are from the nine. Take the time to see it. I recommend you visit after going thru Central HS tour.
Lovely sculpture. A personal quote from each student encircles the piece which is poignant. Worth a visit!
We found out by visiting Central High School that there were actually ten students admitted and one withdrew for some reason.

name: Outlets of Little Rock
reviews: Love the way this mall is built, so much nicer than the other outlet malls I"ve been to.  Love that they have a Lindt candy store, best chocolate ever.
This is a very nice outlet mall. It was clean and they had various things kids could play on in the center area. We shopped at a few stores and the employees were all very friendly.
This is worth the effort! The Outlet has a wonderful selection of shops to visit and I found many great deals throughout the various stores. An enjoyable visit - a must stop!!
It is your typical outlet mall but almost every store that I visited had friendly sales people. It is an outdoor mall so take an umbrella if its raining.

While we were visiting the Little Rock area, we decided that the Outlets of Little Rock would be a great place to shop. How could you find fault with a Factory Outlet that has such great stores like Banana Republic, Bass Factory Outlet, Brooks Brothers, Carter babies and kids, Clarks Outlet, Cole Haan, Famous Footwear, J Crew, Kay Jewelers, Kitchen Collection (my fave), Lane Bryant, Levi's Lindt Chocolate, Old Navy (also a fave), OshKosh B-gosh and VF Outlet (also a fave). And don't let me forget to mention that they also had a Tommy Hilfiger store where I was able to purchase just the cutest purse at a great price either for myself or as a gift. Also, I was hoping to stop by Starbucks for my Java Jolt but I understand that it won't be open until sometime in the Summer!

Hours:  Monday-Saturday 10 am - 9 pm, Sunday 11 am - 6 pm Holiday Hours may Vary

Directions to the Outlets of Little Rock at the Intersection of Interstates 30 and 430
Exit 128 to Bass Pro Parkway.  Outlets of Little Rock is located next to Bass Pro Shops

Travelers Tip:  I always head to their Customer Service desk which was located in their food court for  discount coupons.  And this is the very first place in all my travels where I have come across three designated rest rooms:  Male, Female, and Family (Parents or Parent with an accompanied child or children).  I guess it is because this is a very new Outlet and has only been open for business less than a year!
nice outlet although not big. could find Under Armor and Nike for which I went there. closes early so be sure to have couple of hours to cover the stores.
Love the way this mall is built, so much nicer than the other outlet malls I"ve been to.  Love that they have a Lindt candy store, best chocolate ever.

I’m not a fan of outlets, but I’ve visited this place several times. There’s a good selection of stores, with many of them having a good selection of shopping choices. The walkways and grounds are always neat, clean and well maintained. The restrooms are okay, but it would have been nice if they had paper towels to dry your hands. I hate those air dryer things. The location is good because there’s a nice hotel nearby and decent eating options. If you’re thinking about visiting, consider the cooler months because it’s no fun walking to the different stores in hot temperatures.

They don’t let you walk around with your pet around the Outlets. My wife and I stopped recently when traveling and a very rude Security Guard told her our 6 lbs  Miniature Schnauzer puppy was not allowed anywhere on the Outlets grounds.

If you’re going to be so rude and have a “No Pet Policy” then put up signs that states you’re no pet friendly. This is the first outdoor Outlets mall that is not pet friendly. My wife and I have stopped at many outlets in various states and never encountered this or been treated so rudely

If you don't mind the ins and outs this is a great shopping adventure with something for the whole family. Just make sure you have on a good pair of comfortable shoes and a refreshing treat to beat the heat.

There is a great selection here of inexpensive name brand stores (but be careful, not all are outlets.)  My wife and I have been here several times and always leave with a few items that we picked up pretty cheap.

name: Statehouse Convention Center
reviews: Only reason this is not a 5 star review is parking is a pain and expensive. Everything thing else is golden!  Love the area lots of foods, places for coffee and to hang out, shop, walk and picnic!

Nestled between two hotels, the convention center is convenient to downtown shops, restaurants and the River Market. It's a great venue for an event requiring accommodations for up to several hundred people.

Great place to see and meet. Was there for conference. The only real downside is the cost to valet park or pay for parking. You will pay $26.00 per day for valet if not validated. Rooms are nice, area has many many food choices. Near the Robinson center so catch a show if you can and next door to the Old Statehouse Museum. I enjoyed the area.

We stayed at the Little Rock Marriott, which was the host hotel for the Little Rock Marathon. The LR Marathon expo and packet pickup was held at the Statehouse Convention Center, which was attached to the LR Marriott. The Convention Center can be exited at the opposite end from the hotel, which makes it very convenient to walk to the various restaurants located in the River Market area, which is on the same street as the Convention Center. Plenty of space for vendors to set up, and the Convention Center allowed race-themed displays outside the expo hall, which was great for photo ops.

It was our first time visiting Little Rock and the Statehouse Convention Center. It is beautiful and very well equipped. I was very pleased by the staff and everyone that helped make Arkansas Comic Con 2019 a success!
I’ve been to many conferences and exhibitions here and find that it’s a good space for meetings with a lot of people. The  location is great. The facility is very clean and modern.

This was my first visit to the Statehouse Convention Center.  It was bright, modern, and clean.  The halls were well lit, the temperature of the rooms good, and direction signage very helpful.  We found public parking directly across from the center.

I visited the Convention center for a private reception.  Although there were no major exhibits or activities planed at the time of my visit, I was able to tour the building and the grounds outside.  This center is centrally located and in walking distance of local stores.  This building is a perfect place to host a convention for large or small groups and has a variety of meeting rooms.

name: Allsopp Park
reviews: Good family park with playground and room to play. My children love playing in the creek that runs through the park.  It’s a great location and we love it.

We noticed this place on the way to a restaurant and checked it out. It’s a nature trail with paths to choose from. The paths are natural so there are roots and sharp rocks you also have to watch out for trail riders on bikes. Neat place it just needs more signage and maybe keep up the paths a little better; overall nice time.

Cute playground & easy, short little trail for the kiddos that goes up to a pavilion.  We went to a really great egg hunt there this year.  The only issue I would have is sometimes the older kids use this as a hangout & then it becomes less appropriate for the littles to be around.

Allsopp Park is a nice park with playgrounds, trails and tennis courts.  We attended a party at the pavilion which is covered and accommodates 20-30 people easily.  The park is much better maintained than when I was a kid and there are plenty of people out hiking and biking even when the weather is colder.  Overall a great place to be outside!

Allsopp Park I stumbled upon while looking at all the beautiful historical homes in Little Rock. The neighborhood was the first “Suburb” of Little Rock. The area is beautiful and when I came across this park I just had to get out and walk it with my dog Kobe. He loved it as well!
